exam_paper.title: 2021年6月大学英语四级考试真题（一）
exam_paper.description: 2021年6月大学英语四级考试真题（第一套）

sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to write an essay titled "Are people becoming addicted to technology?". The statement given below is for your reference. You should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.

content.reference_statement: Numerous studies claim that addiction to technology is real and it has the same effect on the brain as drug addiction.

questions.question_text: Are people becoming addicted to technology?
questions.correct_answer: Technology has penetrated into every corner of modern society, ranging from manufacturing industry to family life. To some extent, people are becoming addicted to technology. First of all, modern people seem to live on technology products. We get connected with each other via Internet, shop online with mobile phones, and enjoy self-service on machines in banks and restaurants. However, many people tend to go to extremes. They rely so heavily on their cellphones that they feel unease once they are not having their cellphones around for more than five minutes. Another typical example is that with the appearance of various social video Apps like TikTok and Kuaishou, people can't resist the temptation of them. They are addicted to the virtual world and even forget to eat, work and communicate with family members or friends. Moreover, numerous studies claim that addiction to technology is real and it has the same effect on the brain as drug addiction. Therefore, it is advisable for modern people to reasonably reduce their addiction to technology while enjoying the convenience brought by it. Nothing should go overboard.
questions.analysis: 本文结构清晰，论点明确，通过First of all、However和Moreover层次递进的方式对论点展开论证，利用题目要求给出的科学证据增强文章说服力。
questions.explanation: 背景描述引出话题，提出论点，层次递进论证，利用科学证据增强说服力，得出结论并提出建议。

sections.directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

questions.question_text: What did Joe's parents decide to do?

options.text: Enrol him in a Newcastle football club.
Send him to an after-school art class.
Forbid him to draw in his workbook.
Help him post his drawings online.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻开头提到，乔的父母决定送他去参加一个课外艺术班来鼓励他的创造力。
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到乔的父母没有改掉他在学校练习册上画画的习惯，而是决定送他去参加课外艺术班。

questions.question_text: What did the restaurant "Number 4" do?

options.text: Contacted Joe to decorate its dining-room.
Hired Joe to paint all the walls of its buildings.
Renovated its kitchen and all the dining-rooms.
Asked Joe for permission to use his online drawings.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到餐厅联系了乔的老师，询问乔能否用自己的绘画作品来装饰其餐厅。
questions.explanation: 纽卡斯尔"4号"餐厅联系了乔的老师，询问乔能否用自己的绘画作品来装饰其餐厅。

questions.question_text: What is Kirsteen Marshall trying to do?

options.text: Beg for help from the police.
Identify the suspect on the security video.
Post pictures of her pet dog on social media.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻开头提到，克里斯汀·马歇尔在社交网站上传视频祈求她的宠物狗能平安回家。
questions.explanation: 克里斯汀·马歇尔在社交媒体上发布视频祈求宠物狗平安回家。

questions.question_text: What does the news report say about Kirsteen Marshall's family?

options.text: It is suffering a great deal from the incident.
It is helping the police with the investigation.
It is bringing the case to the local district court.
It is offering a big reward to anyone who helps.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到这家人现在悬赏5000英镑以求狗的安全归还。
questions.explanation: 这家人发起社交媒体活动寻找小偷，并悬赏5000英镑以求狗的安全归还。

questions.question_text: What does Guy Wilson say his café aims to do?

options.text: Provide free meals to the local poor.
Help people connect with each other.
Help eliminate class difference in his area.

questions.analysis: 目的原因题。咖啡馆主人盖伊·威尔逊说他开咖啡馆目的不是赚钱，而是建立社区联系。
questions.explanation: 盖伊·威尔逊说他的咖啡馆旨在建立社区，而不是盈利，通过提供人们吃得起的早餐为不同背景的人们搭建沟通桥梁。

questions.question_text: What does the news report say about Eggs & Bread café?

options.text: It does not supervise its employees.
It donates regularly to a local charity.
It is open round the clock.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到咖啡馆不使用志愿者，但会付给员工费用以保证服务的连续性。
questions.explanation: 咖啡馆由两名员工或主管轮流值班，不使用志愿者，但会付给员工费用以保证服务的连续性。

questions.question_text: What happens when people start to know each other according to Guy Wilson?

options.text: They will realise the importance of communication.
They will come to the café even more frequently.
They will care less about their own background.
They will find they have something in common.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻末尾提到当人们开始了解周围的人时，他们会意识到他们与别人并无太大不同。
questions.explanation: 当人们开始了解周围的人时，他们会意识到他们与别人并无太大不同，不管他们的经济、教育背景怎样，大多数人都有共同之处。

sections.directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions.

questions.question_text: What are the speakers mainly talking about?

options.text: A surprise party for Paul's birthday.
Travel plans for the coming weekend.
The new market on the other side of town.

questions.analysis: 主旨大意题。对话开头，男士询问女士周六聚会的具体时间，随后讨论聚会需要准备的食物、音乐等。
questions.explanation: 双方主要讨论的是聚会的准备工作。

questions.question_text: Why does the woman say it is a good idea to serve foods that guests can help themselves to?

options.text: It makes the hostess's job a whole lot easier.
It enables guests to walk around and chat freely.
It saves considerable time and labor.
It requires fewer tables and chairs.

questions.analysis: 目的原因题。女士说提供三明治和点心，这样客人可以来回走动，互相交流。
questions.explanation: 女士认为这样客人可以来回走动，互相交流，或坐在他们喜欢的地方。

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about the new supermarket?

options.text: It is quite close to her house.
It is more spacious and less crowded.
It sells local wines and soft drinks.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中女士提到，她听说这家新超市为了吸引顾客提供了很大折扣。
questions.explanation: 女士听说新超市为了吸引顾客提供了很大折扣。

questions.question_text: What does the man suggest they ask Paul to do?

options.text: Cook a dish for the party.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话末尾女士询问准备什么音乐，男士建议让保罗带着电脑和扬声器。
questions.explanation: 男士建议让保罗带着电脑和扬声器，这样他们就可以放点音乐了。

questions.question_text: Why does the woman want to have a car?
questions.analysis: 目的原因题。对话开头女士说自己想要辆车，虽然她不需要每天都用车，但是她认为周末有辆车出行会很方便。
questions.explanation: 女士想要辆车主要是为了周末出行方便。

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about German cars?
questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中女士提到，她听说德国汽车很可靠。
questions.explanation: 女士听说德国汽车很可靠。

questions.question_text: What does the man recommend the woman do?
questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。男士说自己有个卖二手车的朋友，他对汽车非常了解，女士可以给他打电话问一下汽车方面的问题。
questions.explanation: 男士建议女士可以请教他的朋友。

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the man's friend from the conversation?

options.text: He is a successful car dealer.

questions.analysis: 细节推断题。男士说朋友绝不会施加任何压力，让女士不用担心，而且男士的朋友很乐意帮忙。
questions.explanation: 男士的朋友是值得信任的。

sections.directions: In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about early pigs in North America?

options.text: Many escaped from farms and became wild.
They were actually native to North America.
Many got killed in the wild when searching for food.
They were hunted by Spanish and Russian explorers.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文开头指出，在早期，人们允许猪自由走动寻找食物，这种做法也使得许多猪从农场逃到野外生活。
questions.explanation: 在早期，人们允许猪自由走动寻找食物，这种做法也使得许多猪从农场逃到野外生活。

questions.question_text: Why are wild pigs a threat to humans?

options.text: They often make sudden attacks on people.
They break up nature's food supply chain.
They carry a great many diseases.

questions.analysis: 目的原因题。短文中提到，野猪携带数十种威胁人类和农场动物的疾病。
questions.explanation: 野猪携带数十种威胁人类和农场动物的疾病。

questions.question_text: What happened to the native foxes on one particular United States island?

options.text: They lived peacefully with wild pigs.
They ran out of food completely.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文末尾提到，这些鹰在岛上繁殖，以本土狐狸为食，狐狸几乎被灭绝了。
questions.explanation: 这些鹰在岛上繁殖，以本土狐狸为食，狐狸几乎被灭绝了。

questions.question_text: What are a pair of entrepreneurs planning to do?

options.text: Taste coffee while in outer space.
Roast coffee beans in outer space.
Develop a new strain of coffee bean.
Use a pressurised tank to brew coffee.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文开头提到，两名企业家正计划建造并发射一艘宇宙飞船，该飞船将携带咖啡豆并在外太空烘焙。
questions.explanation: 两名企业家正计划建造并发射一艘宇宙飞船，该飞船将携带咖啡豆并在外太空烘焙。

questions.question_text: What does the passage say about coffee beans roasted on Earth?

options.text: They float around in the oven.
They have to be heated to 360°C.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文中提到，在地球上烘焙咖啡豆，咖啡豆容易在烤炉中裂开烤焦。
questions.explanation: 在地球上烘焙咖啡豆，咖啡豆容易在烤炉中裂开烤焦。

questions.question_text: What did the two Italian companies do in 2015?

options.text: They charged a high price for their space-roasted coffee beans.
They set up a branch in Dubai to manufacture coffee roasters.
They collaborated on building the first space coffee machine.
They abandoned the attempt to roast coffee beans in space.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文末尾提到，2015年，两家意大利公司合作建造了一个类似航天器，那是第一个专门为在太空使用而设计的咖啡机。
questions.explanation: 2015年，两家意大利公司合作建造了第一台太空咖啡机。

questions.question_text: Why do a lot of people come to the village of Takotna every March?

options.text: It is the best time for sightseeing.
A race passes through it annually.
They come to clean the Iditarod Trail.
It is when the villagers choose a queen.

questions.analysis: 目的原因题。短文开头提到，每年三月人数会暴增，因为有一个为期7天的比赛要求参赛者在此地停下来休息24小时。
questions.explanation: 有一个为期7天的比赛要求参赛者在此地停下来休息24小时。

questions.question_text: What is the village of Takotna famous for?
questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文中提到，塔科特纳村因其美味的水果派闻名。
questions.explanation: 塔科特纳村因其美味的水果派闻名。

questions.question_text: Who comes to help with the event of the year?

options.text: People from the state of Idaho.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文中提到，整个村庄都来帮忙，包括孩子们。
questions.explanation: 整个村庄都来帮忙，包括孩子们。

questions.question_text: What do we learn about Jan Newton?

options.text: She owned a restaurant in Idaho.
She went to Alaska to compete in a race.
She helped the village to become famous.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。短文中提到，Jan Newton从爱达荷州搬到阿拉斯加，开了家餐厅，她的水果派很快引起了参赛者的注意，村庄也因此获得了一些名气。
questions.explanation: Jan Newton帮助村庄获得了名气。

sections.directions: In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage.

content.passage:
Most animals seek shade when temperatures in the Sahara Desert soar to 120 degrees Fahrenheit. But for the Saharan silver ant, crawling from their underground nests into the sun's brutal rays to hunt for food, this is the perfect time to seek lunch. In 2015 these ants were joined in the desert by scientists from two Belgian universities, who spent a month in the extreme heat tracking the ants and digging out their nests. The goal was simple, to discover how the species adapted to the kind of heat that can literally melt the bottom of shoes.

Back in Belgium, the scientists looked at the ants under an electronic microscope and found that their thick, triangular hair reflects light like a prism (棱镜), giving them a metallic reflection and protecting them from the sun's awful heat. When Ph.D. student Quentin Willot removed the hair from an ant with a tiny knife and put it under a heat lamp, its temperature jumped.

The ants' method of staying cool is unique among animals. Could this reflective type of hair protect people? Willot says companies are interested in adapting these ants' method of heat protection for human use, including everything from helping to protect the lives of firefighters to keeping homes cool in summer.

questions.question_text: Blank 26
questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于介词词组from...into之前，需要填入动词的-ing形式或-ed形式。
questions.explanation: 根据上下文，蚂蚁从地下巢穴爬到阳光下，应填入含有'爬行'意义的动词crawling。

questions.question_text: Blank 27
questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于动词不定式符号to之后，介词短语for food之前，因此需要填入动词原形。
questions.explanation: 根据上下文，蚂蚁爬到阳光下是为了寻找食物，应填入含有'寻找，搜寻'意义的动词hunt。

questions.question_text: Blank 28
questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格后是名词heat，因此需要填入形容词。
questions.explanation: 撒哈拉沙漠是极度炎热的，因此空格处应填入含有'非常的，极度的'意义的形容词extreme。

questions.question_text: Blank 29
questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格位于定冠词the之后，因此需要填入名词。
questions.explanation: 此处指的是撒哈拉银蚁，因此空格处应填入含有'动物，物种'意义的名词species。

questions.question_text: Blank 30
questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格位于can和动词melt之间，因此需要填入副词。
questions.explanation: 撒哈拉沙漠的高温的确能将鞋底熔化，因此空格处应填入含有'的确，确实'等强调意义的副词literally。

questions.question_text: Blank 31
questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格位于名词hair之前，与triangular共同修饰hair。
questions.explanation: 这种蚂蚁的毛发可以反射光线，而毛发越多，反射效果越好，才能达到'金属般的反射效果'，因此空格处应填入含有'多的，浓密的'意义的形容词thick。

questions.question_text: Blank 32
questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于主语Quentin Willot之后，宾语the hair之前，因此需要填入动词作谓语。
questions.explanation: 昆汀·维洛特把毛发从蚂蚁身上取下，然后把蚂蚁放到加热灯下，以验证毛发的隔热效果。因此空格处应填入含有'取下，移除'意义的动词removed。

questions.question_text: Blank 33
questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格位于不定冠词a之后，名词knife之前，因此需要填入形容词。
questions.explanation: 因为蚂蚁身体很小，所以用的刀子应该也是很小的，因此空格处应填入含有'小的'意义的形容词tiny。

questions.question_text: Blank 34
questions.analysis: 语义推断题。空格位于系动词is之后，因此需要填入形容词或动词的分词形式。
questions.explanation: 本句说明了这种方法的特点，在备选项中，只有unique是形容性质特点的。

questions.question_text: Blank 35
questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于固定搭配are interested in之后及名词短语these ants' method之前，因此需要填入动词的-ing形式。
questions.explanation: 将这种方法应用到人类身上，因此空格处应填入含有'应用于，使用于'意义的动词adapting。

sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived.

content.passage_title: The start of high school doesn't have to be stressful

questions.question_text: The number of people experiencing depression shows a sharp increase in the first year of high school.
questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位到E段第一句。
questions.explanation: 研究发现，高中一年级通常是人生中抑郁症增加最多的年份之一。

questions.question_text: According to one study, students' academic performance is not the only decisive factor of their stress responses.
questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位到G段倒数第二句。
questions.explanation: 身体的应激反应并非仅仅取决于一个人的成绩。

questions.question_text: Researchers would like to explore further how parents and schools can help ninth graders by changing their mindset.
questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位到J段倒数第二句。
questions.explanation: 我们还希望了解老师、家长或学校辅导员如何帮助学生正确看待持续存在的学业或社交困难。

questions.question_text: According to one study, each high school graduate contributes at least 500,000 dollars to the local economy.
questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位到C段倒数第二句。
questions.explanation: 每多一名完成高中毕业的学生，其对当地经济产生的终生收益为50万美元或更多。

questions.question_text: In one study, students were told their social position in school is not unchangeable.
questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位到H段第二句。
questions.explanation: 研究人员没有教学生他们的聪明才智可以改变，而是告诉他们，他们的社会地位可以随着时间的推移而改变。

questions.question_text: It is reported that depression results in enormous economic losses worldwide.
questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位到E段最后一句。
questions.explanation: 世界卫生组织报告称，从治疗总成本和生产力损失来看，抑郁症是全世界负担最重的疾病。

questions.question_text: One study showed that friendships among ninth graders were far from stable.
questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位到D段最后一句。
questions.explanation: 一项针对九年级学生的研究发现，九年级学生中有50%的友谊从一个月到下个月就发生了变化，这表明友谊存在显著的不稳定性。

questions.question_text: More than half of students will find their academic performance declining sharply when they enter the ninth grade.
questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位到A段第四句。
questions.explanation: 近三分之二的学生会经历'九年级冲击'，这是指学生的学业成绩急剧下降。

questions.question_text: Researchers found through experiments that students could be taught to respond to stress in a more positive way.
questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位到I段最后两句。
questions.explanation: 当学生们被教导人是可以改变的，他们就能更好地应对压力，部分原因是他们觉得自己有能力来应对苛刻的状况。

questions.question_text: It is beneficial to explore ways to cope with the challenges facing students entering high school.
questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位到F段第一句。
questions.explanation: 探索能够做些什么来迎接过渡到高中所面临的学生、社交和情感的挑战是值得的。

sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C) and D).

questions.question_text: What does the author say about educators?

options.text: They seek advice from technology companies to achieve teaching goals.
They have been successful in preparing the workforce for companies.
They help students acquire the skills needed for their future success.
They partner with technology companies to enhance teaching efficiency.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位到首段前两句。
questions.explanation: 教育工作者和商界领袖的共同点比看起来要多。教师希望为学生成功的未来做好准备。

questions.question_text: How can educators better develop students' STEM skills, according to the author?

options.text: By blending them with traditional, stimulating activities.
By inviting business leaders to help design curriculums.
By enhancing students' ability to think in a critical way.
By showing students the best way to learn is through play.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第二段第一、二句。
questions.explanation: 当STEM技能与传统的动手创造性活动相结合时，这些技能会增强。

questions.question_text: How do children acquire the skills needed for the 21st century?

options.text: By engaging in activities involving specific technologies.
By playing with things to solve problems on their own.
By familiarizing themselves with high-tech gadgets.
By mastering basic principles through teamwork.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第三段第一、二句。
questions.explanation: 21世纪最重要的技能与特定的技术或主题无关，而是与创造力有关，这些都是孩子们鼓捣小玩意时获得的技能。

questions.question_text: What can we do to help children learn the basics of math and geometry?

options.text: Stimulate their interest as early as possible.
Spend more time playing games with them.
Encourage them to make things with hands.
Allow them to tinker freely with calculators.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第四段最后一句。
questions.explanation: 搭积木这种类型的游戏帮助孩子们发现和掌握数学和几何学的关键原理。

questions.question_text: What does the author advise disadvantaged schools and communities to do?

options.text: Train students to be makers to meet future market demands.
Develop students' creative skills with the resources available.
Engage students with challenging tasks to foster their creativity.
Work together with companies to improve their teaching facilities.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到文章最后一段最后三句。
questions.explanation: 利用手边的任何材料，让孩子们去鼓捣小玩意，这是运用那些重要的'制造者'技能的一个简单方法。

questions.question_text: What does the author say about working in IT?

options.text: It does not appeal to him.
It does not match his abilities.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第一段第一句。
questions.explanation: '我'并不羡慕信息技术工作者的工作。

questions.question_text: What is the finding of a recent survey on employees who have a job reliant on IT support?

options.text: Many employees are deeply frustrated by IT.
Most employees rely heavily on IT in their work.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位到第二段。
questions.explanation: 那些自身工作依赖信息技术支持的员工认为，信息技术是他们工作不满意的主要原因。

questions.question_text: What is said to happen when IT is functioning properly?

options.text: There is a big boost in employees' work efficiency.
Employees become more dependent on machines.
There are no longer any boring or repetitive tasks.
Employees become more confident in their work.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第三段第三、四句。
questions.explanation: 当信息技术正常运作时，员工的自信心就会增加。

questions.question_text: What should business leaders do before implementing new IT initiatives?

options.text: Consider the various expectations of their customers.
Draw up a list of the efficiencies to be promised.
Assess the swollen cost of training the employees.
Think about the possible effects on their employees.

questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位到第三段最后一句。
questions.explanation: 业务领导在实施信息技术计划时很少考虑这些更改将如何影响终端用户时，就会发生问题。

questions.question_text: How can a business help improve its employees' experience in using IT?

options.text: By designing systems that suit their needs.
By ensuring that their mental health is sound.
By adjusting their work to suit the IT system.
By offering them regular in-service training.

questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。定位到文章最后一段。
questions.explanation: 企业需要建立自己的信息技术基础设施，使其设计能够适应员工的工作，而不是让员工调整自己的工作以适应公司的信息技术系统。

sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.

content.chinese_text: 铁观音(Tieguanyin)是中国最受欢迎的茶之一，原产于福建省安溪县西坪镇，如今安溪全县普遍种植，但该县不同地区生产的铁观音又各具风味。铁观音一年四季均可采摘，尤以春秋两季采摘的茶叶品质最佳。铁观音的加工非常复杂，需要专门的技术和丰富的经验。铁观音含有多种维生素，喝起来口感独特。常饮铁观音有助于预防心脏病、降低血压、增强记忆力。

questions.question_text: 铁观音翻译题
questions.correct_answer: Tieguanyin, one of the most favored types of tea in China, is native to Xiping Town, Anxi County, Fujian Province. Now planted throughout Anxi County, the tea varies in its flavor in different regions of the county. Tieguanyin can be gathered through all seasons, tasting the best particularly when picked in spring and fall. The complex processing of the tea calls for specialized skills and abundant experience. The drink, rich in vitamins and with a distinct taste, helps prevent heart diseases, lower blood pressure and enhance memory if consumed regularly.
questions.analysis: 本题考查中译英能力，需要注意专有名词翻译、句子结构转换和语法准确性。
questions.explanation: 翻译时要注意专有名词的准确翻译，长句的合理拆分，以及动词时态和语态的正确使用。
